articles.title: White Paper on Human Rights Violations in U.S. in 2017 Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
White Paper on Human Rights Violations in U.S. in 2017 Issued in DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Institute of International Studies Tuesday released the "White Paper on Human Rights Violations in U.S. in 2017".
					 According to the white paper, soon after being inaugurated as president, Trump filled the important posts of his administration with billionaires, who had "contributed" to his election campaign, and their mouthpieces.
					
					 Secretary of State Tillerson, Secretary of Commerce Ross and also the secretaries of Treasury and Defense are all billionaires from conglomerates. The total assets of public servants at the level of deputy secretary and above of the current administration are worth of 14 billion US$.
					
					 The anti-popular policies the Trump administration pursued openly in one year were, without exception, for the interests of a handful of the rich circles.
					
					 In the U.S., where genuine freedom of the press and expression does not exist, intervention in and crackdown on the press grew more intensified over the past one year.
					
					 In 2017 the cases of searching and confiscation against journalists accounted for 12 and the cases of violation against them for 11. Moreover, 19 persons in the domestic press circles and four foreign journalists were arrested or detained.
					
					 Racial discrimination and misanthropy are serious maladies inherent to the social system of the U.S., and they have been aggravated since Trump took office.
					
					 The racial violence that took place in Charlottesville, Virginia, on August 12 is a typical example of the acme of the current administration's policy of racism.
					
					 In the U.S. the absolute majority of the working masses, deprived of elementary rights to survival, are hovering in the abyss of nightmare.
					
					As a result, during the first week of March, 241,000 persons joined the large contingent of the unemployed; in May 9,000 public servants were fired from governmental agencies; in September the number of the unemployed increased by 33,000 as compared to that of the previous month.
					
					 In particular, unemployment of young people has become a matter of serious social concern; currently the unemployment rate of young people under 25 is 7.9%, and 31% of graduates from high schools do not have proper jobs.
					
					According to what the U.S. administration made public, in 2017 the homeless numbered 554,000, about 10% increase as compared to that two years ago, and number of the poor families, living in rented rooms devoid of elementary facilities for living, is on the steady rise.
					
					 The soaring school expenses are plunging the students into the hell of loans.
					
					Those who are diagnosed with a disease but cannot afford to pay their medical fees total 50 million. Flu, lung diseases and asthma cause 36,000, 40,000 and 150,000 deaths, respectively, on an annual average.
					
					 On the other hand, health-hazardous disqualified products are on sale across the country, which often leads to an outbreak of infectious diseases.
					
					 The U.S. is one of the world's two countries that have yet to embrace paid maternity leave.
					
					 Over the past decade the proportion of American women who live below the poverty line has risen from 12.1% to 14.5%, and they usually receive 25% less salary than their male colleagues of the same post.
					
					 A woman is sexually abused every 89 seconds.
					
					According to basic statistics, about 61,100 gun-related crimes took place in the U.S. last year, leaving 15,488 dead and 31,058 wounded.
					
					 According to data, the number of marijuana users in the U.S. was more than 20 million, a 3% increase as compared with that a decade ago; and over 90 people lose their lives on a daily average from drug abuse.
					
					 In the U.S. where crimes and evil are rampant, the number of imprisoned criminals tops 2.3 million and 70 million are ex-offenders.
					
					 The U.S., "guardian of democracy" and "human rights champion", is kicking up the human rights racket but it can never camouflage its true identity as the gross violator of human rights, the white paper said.

articles.title: Famous Thaechon Lacquer Wares
articles.content:
Famous Thaechon Lacquer Wares
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- Thaechon County in North Phyongan Province of the DPRK is well known over the country for having a large forest of lacquer trees.
					 Lacquer is a white-grey natural paint that is considered not to be made artificially, and the lacquer produced in Thaechon area is of best quality.
					
					 The color of lacquer changes into black or red or brown after being exposed to air. And the hardened lacquer takes a polish when it is rubbed.
					
					 The natural and geographical conditions in Thaechon County are favorable for the growth of lacquer trees, as the area has soggy soil with much rainfall.
					
					 From long ago, lacquer wares have been popular in Pyongyang and other parts of the country and, in particular, there had been a great demand on lacquer wares produced in Thaechon at home and abroad in the end of the Feudal Joson Dynasty (1392-1910).
					
					 Now, the Thaechon-lacquer craft has been further developed, thanks to the policy of the Workers' Party of Korea for the protection of national heritage.

articles.title: U.S. Branded as Mastermind of Nuclear War
articles.content:
U.S. Branded as Mastermind of Nuclear War
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists are the root cause of all misfortunes and sufferings of the Korean nation and heinous enemy of peace, Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 On July 15, 1957 the U.S. declared that it would start to arm its imperialist aggression troops in south Korea with nuclear weapons. On Jan. 29, 1958 it announced that it introduced nuclear weapons into south Korea.
					
					 From long ago, the U.S. has turned south Korea into a nuclear advanced base, running amuck to realize its design for aggression on the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and Northeast Asia.
					
					 After the emergence of the Trump administration the moves of the U.S. imperialists to ignite a nuclear war have reached climax.
					
					 They try to browbeat the DPRK by sending three nuclear aircraft carrier strike groups to the waters off the Korean Peninsula and its vicinity.
					
					 This goes to prove that the U.S. imperialists are frantic with the moves to ignite a nuclear war at any cost on the Korean Peninsula, trampling down the aspiration and demand of the Korean nation for peace and reunification.
					
					 The U.S. spawned the nuclear issue of the Korean Peninsula and it is the mastermind of nuclear war. It is very shameless that such heinous nuclear criminal talks about "dismantlement of nukes," under the pretext of "nuclear threat" from someone.
					
					 The harsher nuclear threat and blackmail the U.S. poses, the further the DPRK will bolster up nuclear deterrent for self-defence.

articles.title: Doom of U.S. Is Inevitable: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Doom of U.S. Is Inevitable: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the CBS of the U.S. conducted a poll on its nationals. Most of the respondents said that society was divided, ethnic and racial tensions mushroomed and they don't trust the political system which enforces policies only for the good of the few.
					 This is the reality of the U.S., says Rodong Sinmun in a commentary Tuesday.
					
					 The daily-growing socio-economic inequalities in the U.S. are a realistic factor which quickens the national division, the commentary says, adding:
					
					 The U.S. is seen as a country with the worst socio-economic inequalities in the world, where the gap between the rich and the poor is increasing day by day and a large number of people live in poverty, whereas the privileged circles no more than one percent of the population have the majority of social wealth. As a result, the rich get richer and the poor poorer and class contradictions go from bad to worse. That's because the government backed by monopolies enforces unfair economic policy for the sake of the few.
					
					 Not a few Americans are doing extreme actions with discontent with the unreasonable policies enforced by the authorities and social system which drive them into catastrophe.
					
					 Downhill is the inevitable fate of the U.S., the empire of evils.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries' Tricks for Overseas Expansion Disclosed
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries' Tricks for Overseas Expansion Disclosed
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the NHK of Japan gave out false news on "missile launch by the DPRK" plunging the whole archipelago into terrible turmoil. In the wake of the appalling confusion, there was an evacuation drill in Tokyo, Japan under the scenario that "missile is coming." Last year more than 20 evacuation drills were waged across Japan but this was reportedly the first time in Tokyo.
					 Rodong Sinmun in a commentary Tuesday says it is part of the Japanese reactionary ruling quarters' cunning tricks to realize its ambition for overseas expansion by creating an atmosphere of terror in Japanese society and revising the constitution with it as an occasion.
					
					 Through false report such as "missile fire" and repeated evacuation drills the Abe group attempts to cause uneasiness and tension among Japanese people in a bid to make them support the constitution revision, says the commentary, adding:
					
					 The Japanese politicians had better stop resorting to thinly veiled tricks. It will be wise that they should remember the past lessons of the defeated nation and accede willingly to the present environment of the region whose strategic structure changed completely.
					
					 The international community never allows Japan's overseas expansion. The militarist revival of Japan will lead to its self-destruction.

articles.title: Minju Joson Stresses Need to Check U.S. Highhanded and Arbitrary Practices
articles.content:
Minju Joson Stresses Need to Check U.S. Highhanded and Arbitrary Practices
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- Days ago, the U.S. Department of State reportedly held a phone press conference to force African countries to join in the sanctions against the Democratic People's Republic of Korea. Acting under-secretary for African affairs, deputy special representative for DPRK policy and other riffraff of the State Department urged African nations to sever diplomatic relations with Pyongyang and expel citizens of the DPRK.
					 This is an illegal violation of a sovereign state's sovereignty and rights to existence and development, Minju Joson Tuesday says in a commentary.
					
					 Stressing that the international community should call to task the U.S. moves to stifle the DPRK with nukes, the commentary goes on:
					
					 Now the U.S., that spawned the nuclear issue of the Korean Peninsula, sits in the court of justice, not in the dock, to make up sentences. Meanwhile, not a few countries follow the U.S., and even the Unites Nations blindly joins in the unreasonable U.S. sanctions and pressure against its member nation, aimed at depriving it of the sovereignty and rights to existence and development.
					
					 Such abnormal practices can be often seen in international arena, to say nothing of the Korean Peninsula issue.
					
					 After all, the U.S. runs amuck like a rabid dog.
					
					 If its reckless acts are allowed, the U.S. will continue to break the international justice and foundation of the international relations and this will bring graver consequences.

articles.title: S. Korean Political Party Urges Arrest of Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
S. Korean Political Party Urges Arrest of Lee Myung Bak
Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- A spokesperson for the People's Democratic Party of south Korea issued a commentary on Monday urging the immediate detention of Lee Myung Bak, according to the south Korean online newspaper Minjok Ilbo.
					The commentary charged that Lee Myung Bak squandered hundreds of trillions of won under such pretexts as the four river improvement project and munitions industry, only to cause economic crisis and ruin of the people's livelihood.
					
					It branded him as the arch criminal of evils that spawned the Park Geun Hye regime" in collusion with the Intelligence Service and the military cyber command.
					
					It called for immediately arresting Lee and impounding his enormous illicit assets.

articles.title: Appeal of DPRK Government, Political Parties and Organizations Supported
articles.content:
Appeal of DPRK Government, Political Parties and Organizations Supported
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), made public a statement on January 27 in support of the appeal of the joint conference of the DPRK government, political parties and organizations which called upon all Koreans to turn out as one in the struggle for glorifying this significant year as a year of great changes and great events to eternally shine in the history of national reunification.
					 The statement said that the appeal of the joint conference to improve the north-south relations and make a breakthrough for independent reunification true to the noble patriotic intention of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un reflects the unanimous desire and aspiration of all the fellow countrymen for leading the first step of the hard-won climate for improved north-south relations to an epochal advance for independent reunification.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 We will hold Marshal Kim Jong Un in high esteem as the great loadstar of national reunification and implement his idea and line for independent reunification with the patriotic enthusiasm and will.
					
					 We will actively join in the anti-U.S. sacred struggle to put a definite end to the war drills against the DPRK which will bring nuclear disaster to the homeland, and bring about a new era of peace and reunification, holding fast to the banner of national independence, By Our Nation Itself, as the eternal lifeline for the movement for national reunification.
					
					 The statement expressed the will to make tangible contribution to strengthening the solidarity of the fellow countrymen in the north and the south and abroad and realizing a pan-national gathering for reunification and joint national events this significant year marking the 70th anniversary of the historic Joint Conference of Representatives of Political Parties and Social Organizations in North and South Korea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Egypt
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Egypt
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- An Egyptian preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il was formed on Jan. 17.
					 Yehia Zakaria Khairullah, vice-chairman of the Socialist Freedom Party of Egypt and chairman of the Egypt-Korea Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set a celebration period from Jan. 17 to Feb. 16 and decided to hold a seminar, a film show, a photo exhibition and other political and cultural events praising Kim Jong Il's revolutionary career and exploits in the period.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Kuwait
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Kuwait
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- A Kuwaiti preparatory committee for celebrating leader Kim Jong Il's birth anniversary (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed on Jan. 18.
					 Javid Ahmad, director of the Administrative Department of the Kuwait Times who doubles as chairman of the Kuwait Asian Journalist Association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set a celebration period from Jan. 18 to Feb. 18 and decided to organize colorful political and cultural events including seminar and film show praising Kim Jong Il's revolutionary career and exploits in the period.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Romania
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Romania
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- A Romanian national preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary  of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed on January 19.
					 Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Supreme Council of the Nationalist Socialist Party of Romania, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set a celebration period from January 19 to February 17 and decided to organize political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il in the period.

articles.title: U.S. Hit for Policy Hostile to DPRK
articles.content:
U.S. Hit for Policy Hostile to DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- The Nepal Worker-Peasant Party supported the just cause of the Korean people and denounced the U.S. policy hostile to the DPRK.
					 The resolution adopted at a recent meeting of the Party expressed support and solidarity for the measures taken by the DPRK to increase its military capability for defending its sovereignty from the U.S. war threat.
					
					 It also urged the U.S. to repeal its anti-DPRK sanctions that have been imposed for decades, pull out its troops from south Korea at once and create a favorable climate for the reunification of the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Publicada carta blanca sobre la violacion de DDHH en EE.UU. en 2017
articles.content:
Publicada carta blanca sobre la violacion de DDHH en EE.UU. en 2017
Pyongyang, 30 de enero (ACNC) -- El Instituto de Estudio de los Asuntos Internacionales de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea publico el dia 30 la carta blanca sobre la violacion de derechos humanos en EE.UU. en 2017.
					Tan pronto como tomara el poder, Trump ascendio en los importantes cargos de la administracion a los millonarios y sus voceros que "contribuyeron" a su eleccion presidencial, revela el documento y continua:
					
					El secretario de Estado Tillerson, el del Comercio Ross, el de Tesoro, el de Defensa, etc. tambien son millonarios. Los bienes de los funcionarios superiores al subsecretario de la actual administracion son valorados en 14 mil millones de US$.
					
					Durante el ano pasado, la administracion Trump practico las politicas antipopulares a favor de la minoria de privilegiados.
					
					En la sociedad estadounidense no existe la libertad de prensa y de expresion. En particular, en un ano despues de la toma del poder de Trump, se han intensificado mas que nunca la intervencion y la represion sobre la prensa. 
					
					En el ano 2017, se reportaron 12 incidentes de registro e incautacion y 11 casos de violencia contra los periodistas y fueron detenidos 4 reporteros extranjeros y 19 empleados del circulo de prensa nacional. 
					
					La discriminacion racial y la misantropia se hacen un grave problema del regimen social estadounidense y se agravan mas en el mandato de Trump. 
					
					El incidente de uso de violencia por el problema racial, ocurrido el 12 de agosto en una ciudad del Estado de Virginia, es el ejemplo tipico de la politica racista de la actual administracion. 
					
					Viven en la penuria las abrumadoras masas trabajadoras privadas de los elementales derechos a la subsistencia.
					
					En una semana de marzo, 241 mil personas perdieron el empleo y en mayo, 9 mil empleados fueron expulsados en masas de los organos gubernamentales. 
					
					El numero de desempleados en septiembre se incremento 33 mil mas que el mes anterior. 
					
					Sobre todo, el desempleo de la juventud se presenta como un grave problema social. 
					
					Ahora la tasa de desempleo de los jovenes menores a los 25 anos de edad es de 7.9 %. Y el 31% de los graduados de las escuelas superiores vagabundean sin empleo fijo. 
					
					El numero de los habitantes sin viviendas en 2017 llega a 554 mil con el incremento de 10% en comparacion con el ano 2015. 
					
					Al mismo tiempo, se aumentan cada dia mas las familias pobres que viven en cuartos alquilados de malas condiciones. 
					
					Los universitarios languidecen en dificultad con el pago de los gastos escolares, cada dia mas creciente.
					
					Por falta de dineros, cerca de 50 millones de personas no reciben la asistencia medica y mueren cada ano 36 mil personas por el gripe contagioso, cerca de 40 mil por las enfermedades pulmonares y mas de 150 mil por el asma, respectivamente.
					
					Los articulos defectuosos, que se venden abiertamente, sirven de la fuente de las epidemias.
					
					EE.UU. es uno de dos paises del mundo que no aceptan el sistema de licencia retribuida de maternidad.
					
					Durante 10 anos ultimos, la proporcion de las mujeres pobres ascendio de 12.1% al 14.5% y el salario de las mujeres es 25% menos que los hombres con igual empleo.
					
					A cada 89 segundos, una mujer recibe maltrato sexual.
					
					En 2017 ocurrieron casi 61 mil 100 crimenes de uso de armas, resultando 15 mil 488 muertes y 31 mil 58 lesionados.
					
					El numero de los usuarios de marihuana llego a mas de 20 millones, cifra incrementada en 3% al comparar con la de hace 10 anos y por el abuso de drogas, mas de 90 personas perdieron la vida como promedio al dia.
					
					Los numeros de delincuentes penales y de reincidentes que cumplen la condena llegan a 2 millones 300 mil y 70 millones, respectivamente.
					
					Por mas que EE.UU. describe a su pais como "defensor de la democracia" y "defensor de DDHH" y critica la situacion de los "derechos humanos" de otros paises, no puede encubrir su naturaleza de caudillo de violacion de DDHH, concluyo la carta blanca.
